intro: Hieracium submammatidens, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that are typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium submammatidens is an herbaceous perennial that can form dense colonies, sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
